title.narrative: Skills for Employment Investment Program - Tranche 1

description.narrative: The investment program will support the Government of Bangladesh's reforms in skills development, anchored in the National Skills Development Policy (NSDP), 2011. It will support large-scale private sector involvement and public-private partnership, which is critical to meet existing and future labor market needs and to reduce the skills gap. This in turn is crucial for Bangladesh to move away from the 'low-skill, low-wage equilibriumm' to a 'higher skill, higher wage virtuous cycle' to become a middle income country. The program will help the government to scale-up skilling of new entrants and up-skilling of existing workers to contribute to higher growth of priority sectors. The program will strengthen skills development in Bangladesh and support transition to a sector-wide approach (SWAp) by establishing a unified funding system and enhancing overall coordination of the currently fragmented system.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Increased employment in priority sectors and skills for males and females [NSDP 2 and 3].

Annual share of higher skills training in priority sector increased by 15% (Baseline: 3% increased annually)
